alert.note: Alert for Irion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 8:34PM CDT until May 19 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Irion. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 PM CDT, Radar indicated an area of thunderstorms with very heavy rain, moving east across northern and central Irion County. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches, with localized amounts of 2 to 3 inches, is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mertzon, Sherwood and Arden. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Ranch Road 859 crossing west Rocky Creek, Ranch Road 853 crossing Middle Concho River, RM 853 crossing Dry Draw, crossings along County Road 411, County Road 202 crossing Spring Creek, County Road 202 crossing Lopez Creek and Sherwood Cemetery crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
